alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Seminole, east central Lake and central Volusia Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanford, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, DeLand, Orange City and Lake Helen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Seminole
